00020 /**
00021  * Specify the US location.
00022  */
00023 define('S3_LOCATION_US', 'us');
00024 
00025 /**
00026  * Specify the European Union (EU) location.
00027  */
00028 define('S3_LOCATION_EU', 'eu');
00029 
00030 /**
00031  * ACL: Owner-only read/write.
00032  */
00033 define('S3_ACL_PRIVATE', 'private');
00034 
00035 /**
00036  * ACL: Owner read/write, public read.
00037  */
00038 define('S3_ACL_PUBLIC', 'public-read');
00039 
00040 /**
00041  * ACL: Public read/write.
00042  */
00043 define('S3_ACL_OPEN', 'public-read-write');
00044 
00045 /**
00046  * ACL: Owner read/write, authenticated read.
00047  */
00048 define('S3_ACL_AUTH_READ', 'authenticated-read');
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * PCRE: Match all items
00052  */
00053 define('S3_PCRE_ALL', '/.*/i');

00059 /**
00060  * Container for all Amazon S3-related methods.
00061  * 
00062  * @section example Example Usage:
00063  * @include s3/__construct.phps
00064  */
00065 class AmazonS3 extends TarzanCore
00066 {
00067         /**
00068          * @var The request URL.
00069          */
00070         var $request_url;
00071 
00072         /**
00073          * @var The virtual host setting.
00074          */
00075         var $vhost;

00081         /**
00082          * Constructor
00083          * 
00084          * @public
00085          * @param string $key Your Amazon API Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_KEY constant.
00086          * @param string $secret_key Your Amazon API Secret Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_SECRET_KEY constant.
00087          * @return bool FALSE if no valid values are set, otherwise true.
00088          * @section example Example Usage:
00089          * @include s3/__construct.phps
00090          */
00091         public function __construct($key = null, $secret_key = null)
00092         {
00093                 $this->vhost = null;
00094                 $this->api_version = '2006-03-01';
00095                 parent::__construct($key, $secret_key);
00096         }

00100         // AUTHENTICATION
00101 
00102         /**
00103          * Authenticate
00104          *
00105          * Authenticates a connection to S3.
00106          *
00107          * @access public
00108          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00109          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters for authenticating. See the individual methods for allowed keys.
00110          * @param string $location (Do Not Use) Used internally by this function on occasions when S3 returns a redirect code and it needs to call itself recursively.
00111          * @param integer $redirects (Do Not Use) Used internally by this function on occasions when S3 returns a redirect code and it needs to call itself recursively.
00112          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00113          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTAuthentication.html
00114          */
00115         public function authenticate($bucket, $opt = null, $location = null, $redirects = 0)
00116         {
00117                 // If nothing was passed in, don't do anything.
00118                 if (!$opt)
00119                 {
00120                         return false;
00121                 }
00122                 else
00123                 {
00124                         // Set default values
00125                         $bucket = strtolower($bucket);
00126                         $acl = null;
00127                         $body = null;
00128                         $contentType = null;
00129                         $delimiter = null;
00130                         $filename = null;
00131                         $marker = null;
00132                         $maxKeys = null;
00133                         $method = null;
00134                         $prefix = null;
00135                         $verb = null;
00136                         $lastmodified = null;
00137                         $etag = null;
00138                         $qsa = null;
00139                         $md5 = null;
00140                         $meta = null;
00141                         $hmeta = null;
00142                         $range = null;
00143                         $returnCurlHandle = null;
00144 
00145                         // Break the array into individual variables, while storing the original.
00146                         $_opt = $opt;
00147                         extract($opt);
00148 
00149                         $filename = rawurlencode($filename);
00150 
00151                         // Set hostname
00152                         if ($this->vhost)
00153                         {
00154                                 $hostname = $this->vhost;
00155                         }
00156                         elseif ($method == 'list_buckets')
00157                         {
00158                                 $hostname = 's3.amazonaws.com';
00159                         }
00160                         else
00161                         {
00162                                 $hostname = $bucket . '.s3.amazonaws.com';
00163                         }
00164 
00165                         // Get the UTC timestamp in RFC 2616 format
00166                         $since_epoch = time() + $this->adjust_offset;
00167                         $httpDate = gmdate(DATE_AWS_RFC2616, $since_epoch);
00168 
00169                         // Generate the request string
00170                         $request = '';
00171 
00172                         // Append additional parameters
00173                         $request .= '/' . $filename;
00174 
00175                         // List Object settings
00176                         if ($method == 'list_objects')
00177                         {
00178                                 if (isset($prefix) && !empty($prefix))
00179                                 {
00180                                         $request = '/?prefix=' . $prefix;
00181                                 }
00182                                 else if (isset($marker) && !empty($marker))
00183                                 {
00184                                         $request = '/?marker=' . $marker;
00185                                 }
00186                                 else if (isset($maxKeys) && !empty($maxKeys))
00187                                 {
00188                                         $request = '/?max-keys=' . $maxKeys;
00189                                 }
00190                                 else if (isset($delimiter) && !empty($delimiter))
00191                                 {
00192                                         $request = '/?delimiter=' . $delimiter;
00193                                 }
00194                         }
00195 
00196                         // Logging
00197                         elseif ($method == 'get_logs')
00198                         {
00199                                 $request .= '?logging';
00200                                 $filename .= '?logging';
00201                         }
00202 
00203                         // Get Bucket Locale settings
00204                         elseif ($method == 'get_bucket_locale')
00205                         {
00206                                 $request = '/?location';
00207                                 $filename = '?location';
00208                         }
00209 
00210                         // Add ACL stuff if we're getting/setting ACL preferences.
00211                         elseif ($method == 'get_bucket_acl' || $method == 'get_object_acl')
00212                         {
00213                                 $request .= '?acl';
00214                                 $filename .= '?acl';
00215                         }
00216 
00217                         elseif ($method == 'get_object_url')
00218                         {
00219                                 $filename = rawurldecode($filename);
00220                         }
00221 
00222                         if (!$request == '/')
00223                         {
00224                                 $request = '/' . $request;
00225                         }
00226 
00227                         // Prepare the request.
00228                         if ($location)
00229                         {
00230                                 $this->request_url = $location;
00231                         }
00232                         else
00233                         {
00234                                 $this->request_url = 'http://' . $hostname . $request;
00235                         }
00236 
00237                         // Instantiate the request class
00238                         $req = new $this->request_class($this->request_url);
00239 
00240                         // Do we have a verb?
00241                         if (isset($verb) && !empty($verb))
00242                         {
00243                                 $req->setMethod($verb);
00244                         }
00245 
00246                         // Do we have a contentType?
00247                         if (isset($contentType) && !empty($contentType))
00248                         {
00249                                 $req->addHeader('Content-Type', $contentType);
00250                         }
00251                         else if ($verb == HTTP_PUT) // Set a default value for HTTP_PUT
00252                         {
00253                                 $contentType = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded';
00254                         }
00255 
00256                         // Do we have a date?
00257                         if (isset($httpDate) && !empty($httpDate))
00258                         {
00259                                 $req->addHeader("Date", $httpDate);
00260                         }
00261 
00262                         // Do we have ACL settings? (Optional in signed string)
00263                         if (isset($acl) && !empty($acl))
00264                         {
00265                                 $req->addHeader("x-amz-acl", $acl);
00266                                 $acl = 'x-amz-acl:' . $acl . "\n";
00267                         }
00268 
00269                         // Do we have COPY settings?
00270                         if ($method == 'copy_object')
00271                         {
00272                                 $acl .= 'x-amz-copy-source:/' . $sourceBucket . '/' . $sourceObject . "\n";
00273                                 $req->addHeader('x-amz-copy-source', '/' . $sourceBucket . '/' . $sourceObject);
00274                         }
00275 
00276                         // Are we checking for changes?
00277                         if ($lastmodified && $etag)
00278                         {
00279                                 $req->addHeader('If-Modified-Since', $lastmodified);
00280                                 $req->addHeader('If-None-Match', $etag);
00281                         }
00282 
00283                         // Partial content range
00284                         if ($range)
00285                         {
00286                                 $req->addHeader('Range', 'bytes=' . $range);
00287                         }
00288 
00289                         // Add a body if we're creating
00290                         if ($method == 'create_object' || $method == 'create_bucket')
00291                         {
00292                                 if (isset($body) && !empty($body))
00293                                 {
00294                                         $req->setBody($body);
00295                                         $md5 = $this->util->hex_to_base64(md5($body));
00296                                         $req->addHeader('Content-MD5', $md5);
00297                                 }
00298 
00299                                 // Add any meta headers.
00300                                 if ($meta)
00301                                 {
00302                                         uksort($meta, 'strnatcasecmp');
00303 
00304                                         foreach ($meta as $k => $v)
00305                                         {
00306                                                 $req->addHeader('x-amz-meta-' . strtolower($k), $v);
00307                                                 $hmeta .= 'x-amz-meta-' . strtolower($k) . ':' . $v . "\n";
00308                                         }
00309                                 }
00310                         }
00311 
00312                         // Data that will be "signed".
00313                         $filename = '/' . $filename;
00314 
00315                         // If we're listing buckets, there is no filename value.
00316                         if ($method == 'list_buckets')
00317                         {
00318                                 $filename = '';
00319                         }
00320 
00321                         if ($qsa)
00322                         {
00323                                 // Prepare the string to sign
00324                                 $stringToSign = "$verb\n$md5\n$contentType\n$since_epoch\n$acl$hmeta/$bucket$filename";
00325                         }
00326                         else
00327                         {
00328                                 // Prepare the string to sign
00329                                 $stringToSign = "$verb\n$md5\n$contentType\n$httpDate\n$acl$hmeta/$bucket$filename";
00330                         }
00331 
00332                         // Hash the AWS secret key and generate a signature for the request.
00333                         $signature = $this->util->hex_to_base64(hash_hmac('sha1', $stringToSign, $this->secret_key));
00334 
00335                         // Pass the developer key and signature
00336                         $req->addHeader("Authorization", "AWS " . $this->key . ":" . $signature);
00337 
00338                         // If we have a "true" value for returnCurlHandle, do that instead of completing the request.
00339                         if ($returnCurlHandle)
00340                         {
00341                                 return $req->prepRequest();
00342                         }
00343 
00344                         // Are we getting a Query String Auth?
00345                         if ($qsa)
00346                         {
00347                                 return array(
00348                                         'bucket' => $bucket,
00349                                         'filename' => $filename,
00350                                         'key' => $this->key,
00351                                         'expires' => $since_epoch,
00352                                         'signature' => $signature,
00353                                 );
00354                         }
00355 
00356                         // Send!
00357                         $req->sendRequest();
00358 
00359                         // Prepare the response.
00360                         $headers = $req->getResponseHeader();
00361                         $headers['x-tarzan-redirects'] = $redirects;
00362                         $headers['x-tarzan-requesturl'] = $this->request_url;
00363                         $headers['x-tarzan-stringtosign'] = $stringToSign;
00364                         $headers['x-tarzan-requestheaders'] = $req->request_headers;
00365                         $data = new $this->response_class($headers, $req->getResponseBody(), $req->getResponseCode());
00366 
00367                         // Did Amazon tell us to redirect? Typically happens for multiple rapid requests EU datacenters.
00368                         // @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/Redirects.html
00369                         if ((int) $req->getResponseCode() == 307) // Temporary redirect to new endpoint.
00370                         {
00371                                 $redirects++;
00372                                 $data = $this->authenticate($bucket, 
00373                                         $_opt, 
00374                                         $headers['location'], 
00375                                         $redirects);
00376                         }
00377 
00378                         // Return!
00379                         return $data;
00380                 }
00381         }
00382 
00383         /**
00384          * Set Virtual Host
00385          * 
00386          * Use this virtual host instead of the normal bucket.s3.amazonaws.com domain.
00387          * 
00388          * @access public
00389          * @param string $vhost (Required) The hostname to use instead of bucket.s3.amazonaws.com.
00390          * @return void
00391          * @section example Example Usage:
00392          * @include s3/set_vhost.phps
00393          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?VirtualHosting.html
00394          */
00395         public function set_vhost($vhost)
00396         {
00397                 $this->vhost = $vhost;
00398         }

00401         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00402         // BUCKET METHODS
00403 
00404         /**
00405          * Create Bucket
00406          *
00407          * The bucket holds all of your objects, and provides a globally unique namespace in which you 
00408          * can manage the keys that identify objects. A bucket can hold any number of objects.
00409          *
00410          * @access public
00411          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to create.
00412          * @param string $locale (Optional) Sets the preferred geographical location for the bucket. Accepts S3_LOCATION_US or S3_LOCATION_EU. Defaults to S3_LOCATION_US.
00413          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00414          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00415          * @section example Example Usage:
00416          * @include s3/create_bucket.phps
00417          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketPUT.html
00418          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/UsingBucket.html
00419          */
00420         public function create_bucket($bucket, $locale = null, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00421         {
00422                 // Defaults
00423                 $body = null;
00424                 $contentType = null;
00425 
00426                 if ($locale)
00427                 {
00428                         switch(strtolower($locale))
00429                         {
00430                                 case 'eu':
00431                                         $body = '<CreateBucketConfiguration><LocationConstraint>' . strtoupper($locale) . '</LocationConstraint></CreateBucketConfiguration>';
00432                                         $contentType = 'application/xml';
00433                                         break;
00434                         }
00435                 }
00436 
00437                 // Authenticate to S3
00438                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, array(
00439                         'verb' => HTTP_PUT,
00440                         'method' => 'create_bucket',
00441                         'body' => $body,
00442                         'contentType' => $contentType,
00443                         'returnCurlHandle' => $returnCurlHandle
00444                 ));
00445         }
00446 
00447         /**
00448          * Get Bucket
00449          *
00450          * Referred to as "GET Bucket" in the AWS docs, but implemented here as AmazonS3::list_objects().
00451          * 
00452          * @access public
00453          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00454          * @see list_objects
00455          */
00456         public function get_bucket($bucket, $opt = null)
00457         {
00458                 if (!$opt)
00459                 {
00460                         $opt = array();
00461                 }
00462 
00463                 return $this->list_objects($bucket, $opt);
00464         }
00465 
00466         /**
00467          * Get Bucket Locale
00468          *
00469          * Lists the location constraint of the bucket. U.S.-based buckets have no response.
00470          *
00471          * @access public
00472          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00473          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00474          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00475          * @section example Example Usage:
00476          * @include s3/get_bucket_locale.phps
00477          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketLocationGET.html
00478          */
00479         public function get_bucket_locale($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00480         {
00481                 // Add this to our request
00482                 $opt = array();
00483                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00484                 $opt['method'] = 'get_bucket_locale';
00485                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00486 
00487                 // Authenticate to S3
00488                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00489         }
00490 
00491         /**
00492          * HEAD Bucket
00493          * 
00494          * Reads only the HTTP headers of an object within a bucket.
00495          *
00496          * @access public
00497          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00498          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00499          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00500          * @section example Example Usage:
00501          * @include s3/head_bucket.phps
00502          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectHEAD.html
00503          */
00504         public function head_bucket($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00505         {
00506                 // Add this to our request
00507                 $opt = array();
00508                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_HEAD;
00509                 $opt['method'] = 'head_bucket';
00510                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00511 
00512                 // Authenticate to S3
00513                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00514         }
00515 
00516         /**
00517          * If Bucket Exists
00518          * 
00519          * Checks whether this bucket already exists in your account or not.
00520          * 
00521          * @access public
00522          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00523          * @return boolean Whether it exists or not.
00524          * @section example Example Usage:
00525          * @include s3/if_bucket_exists.phps
00526          */
00527         public function if_bucket_exists($bucket)
00528         {
00529                 $header = $this->head_bucket($bucket);
00530                 return $header->isOK();
00531         }
00532 
00533         /**
00534          * Delete Bucket
00535          *
00536          * All objects in the bucket must be deleted before the bucket itself can be deleted.
00537          *
00538          * @access public
00539          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to delete.
00540          * @param boolean $force (Optional) Whether to force-delete the bucket and all of its contents. Defaults to false.
00541          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00542          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse|boolean Standard TarzanHTTPResponse if normal bucket deletion or if forced bucket deletion was successful, a boolean false if the forced deletion was unsuccessful.
00543          * @section example Example Usage:
00544          * @include s3/delete_bucket.phps
00545          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketDELETE.html
00546          */
00547         public function delete_bucket($bucket, $force = false, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00548         {
00549                 // Set default value
00550                 $success = true;
00551 
00552                 if ($force)
00553                 {
00554                         // Delete all of the items from the bucket.
00555                         $success = $this->delete_all_objects($bucket);
00556                 }
00557 
00558                 // As long as we were successful...
00559                 if ($success)
00560                 {
00561                         // Add this to our request
00562                         $opt = array();
00563                         $opt['verb'] = HTTP_DELETE;
00564                         $opt['method'] = 'delete_bucket';
00565                         $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00566 
00567                         // Authenticate to S3
00568                         return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00569                 }
00570 
00571                 return false;
00572         }
00573 
00574         /**
00575          * Copy Bucket
00576          * 
00577          * Copies the contents of a bucket into a new bucket.
00578          * 
00579          * @access public
00580          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the source bucket.
00581          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the destination bucket.
00582          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00583          * @section example Example Usage:
00584          * @include s3/copy_bucket.phps
00585          */
00586         public function copy_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket)
00587         {
00588                 // Since S3 can't yet copy across geographical locations, make sure that the new bucket matches the existing bucket.
00589                 $locale = $this->get_bucket_locale($source_bucket);
00590                 switch ($locale->body)
00591                 {
00592                         case S3_LOCATION_EU:
00593                                 $locale = S3_LOCATION_EU;
00594                                 break;
00595 
00596                         default:
00597                                 $locale = S3_LOCATION_US;
00598                                 break;
00599                 }
00600 
00601                 $dest = $this->create_bucket($dest_bucket, $locale);
00602 
00603                 if ($dest->isOK())
00604                 {
00605                         $list = $this->get_object_list($source_bucket);
00606                         $handles = array();
00607         
00608                         foreach ($list as $item)
00609                         {
00610                                 $handles[] = $this->copy_object($source_bucket, $item, $dest_bucket, $item, array(
00611                                         'acl' => S3_ACL_PRIVATE, 
00612                                         'returnCurlHandle' => true
00613                                 ));
00614                         }
00615 
00616                         $request = new $this->request_class(null);
00617                         return $request->sendMultiRequest($handles);
00618                 }
00619 
00620                 return false;
00621         }
00622 
00623         /**
00624          * Rename Bucket
00625          * 
00626          * Renames a bucket by making a copy and deleting the original.
00627          * 
00628          * @access public
00629          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the source bucket.
00630          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the destination bucket.
00631          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00632          * @section example Example Usage:
00633          * @include s3/rename_bucket.phps
00634          */
00635         public function rename_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket)
00636         {
00637                 $responses['copy'] = $this->copy_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket);
00638                 $responses['delete'] = $this->delete_bucket($source_bucket, true);
00639 
00640                 return $responses;
00641         }
00642 
00643         /**
00644          * Get Bucket Size
00645          * 
00646          * Gets the number of files in the bucket.
00647          * 
00648          * @access public
00649          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00650          * @return integer The number of files in the bucket.
00651          * @section example Example Usage:
00652          * @include s3/get_bucket_size.phps
00653          */
00654         public function get_bucket_size($bucket)
00655         {
00656                 return count($this->get_object_list($bucket));
00657         }
00658 
00659         /**
00660          * Get Bucket File Size
00661          * 
00662          * Gets the file size of the contents of the bucket.
00663          * 
00664          * @access public
00665          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00666          * @param boolean $friendly_format (Optional) Whether to format the value to 2 decimal points using the largest possible unit (i.e. 3.42 GB).
00667          * @return integer|string The number of bytes as an integer, or the friendly format as a string.
00668          * @section example Example Usage:
00669          * @include s3/get_bucket_filesize.phps
00670          */
00671         public function get_bucket_filesize($bucket, $friendly_format = false)
00672         {
00673                 $filesize = 0;
00674                 $list = $this->list_objects($bucket);
00675 
00676                 foreach ($list->body->Contents as $filename)
00677                 {
00678                         $filesize += (int) $filename->Size;
00679                 }
00680 
00681                 if ($friendly_format)
00682                 {
00683                         $filesize = $this->util->size_readable($filesize);
00684                 }
00685 
00686                 return $filesize;
00687         }
00688 
00689         /**
00690          * List Buckets
00691          * 
00692          * Gets a list of all of the buckets on the S3 account.
00693          * 
00694          * @access public
00695          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00696          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00697          * @section example Example Usage:
00698          * @include s3/list_buckets.phps
00699          */
00700         public function list_buckets($returnCurlHandle = null)
00701         {
00702                 // Add this to our request
00703                 $opt = array();
00704                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00705                 $opt['method'] = 'list_buckets';
00706                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00707 
00708                 // Authenticate to S3
00709                 return $this->authenticate('', $opt);
00710         }
00711 
00712         /**
00713          * Get Bucket List
00714          * 
00715          * ONLY lists the bucket names on the S3 account.
00716          * 
00717          * @access public
00718          * @param string $pcre (Optional) A Perl-Compatible Regular Expression (PCRE) to filter the bucket names against.
00719          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00720          * @section example Example Usage:
00721          * @include s3/get_bucket_list.phps
00722          */
00723         public function get_bucket_list($pcre = null)
00724         {
00725                 // Set some default values
00726                 $bucketnames = array();
00727 
00728                 // Get a list of buckets.
00729                 $list = $this->list_buckets();
00730 
00731                 // If we have a PCRE regex, store it.
00732                 if ($pcre)
00733                 {
00734                         // Loop through and find the bucket names.
00735                         foreach ($list->body->Buckets->Bucket as $bucket)
00736                         {
00737                                 $bucket = (string) $bucket->Name;
00738 
00739                                 if (preg_match($pcre, $bucket))
00740                                 {
00741                                         $bucketnames[] = $bucket;
00742                                 }
00743                         }
00744                 }
00745                 else
00746                 {
00747                         // Loop through and find the bucket names.
00748                         foreach ($list->body->Buckets->Bucket as $bucket)
00749                         {
00750                                 $bucketnames[] = (string) $bucket->Name;
00751                         }
00752                 }
00753 
00754                 return (count($bucketnames) > 0) ? $bucketnames : null;
00755         }
00756 
00757         /**
00758          * Get Bucket ACL
00759          * 
00760          * Gets the ACL settings for a bucket.
00761          * 
00762          * @access public
00763          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00764          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00765          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00766          * @section example Example Usage:
00767          * @include s3/get_bucket_acl.phps
00768          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
00769          */
00770         public function get_bucket_acl($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00771         {
00772                 // Add this to our request
00773                 $opt = array();
00774                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00775                 $opt['method'] = 'get_bucket_acl';
00776                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00777 
00778                 // Authenticate to S3
00779                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00780         }
00781 
00782         /**
00783          * Set Bucket ACL
00784          * 
00785          * Sets the ACL settings for a bucket.
00786          * 
00787          * @access public
00788          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00789          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00790          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00791          * @section example Example Usage:
00792          * @include s3/set_bucket_acl.phps
00793          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
00794          */
00795         public function set_bucket_acl($bucket, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00796         {
00797                 // Add this to our request
00798                 $opt = array();
00799                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
00800                 $opt['method'] = 'set_bucket_acl';
00801                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00802                 $opt['acl'] = $acl;
00803 
00804                 // Authenticate to S3
00805                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00806         }

00809         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00810         // OBJECT METHODS
00811 
00812         /**
00813          * Create Object
00814          *
00815          * Once you have a bucket, you can start storing objects in it. Objects are stored using the HTTP 
00816          * PUT method. Each object can hold up to 5 GB of data. When you store an object, S3 streams the 
00817          * data to multiple storage servers in multiple data centers to ensure that the data remains 
00818          * available in the event of internal network or hardware failure.
00819          *
00820          * @access public
00821          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00822          * @param array $opt (Required) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00823          * <ul>
00824          *   <li>string filename - (Required) The filename for the content.</li>
00825          *   <li>string body - (Required) The data to be stored in the object.</li>
00826          *   <li>string contentType - (Required) The type of content that is being sent in the body.</li>
00827          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.</li>
00828          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00829          *   <li>array meta - (Optional) Associative array of key-value pairs. Represented by x-amz-meta-: Any header starting with this prefix is considered user metadata. It will be stored with the object and returned when you retrieve the object. The total size of the HTTP request, not including the body, must be less than 4 KB.</li>
00830          * </ul>
00831          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00832          * @section example Example Usage:
00833          * @include s3/create_object.phps
00834          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectPUT.html
00835          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTAccessPolicy.html
00836          */
00837         public function create_object($bucket, $opt = null)
00838         {
00839                 if (!$opt)
00840                 {
00841                         $opt = array();
00842                 }
00843 
00844                 // Add this to our request
00845                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
00846                 $opt['method'] = 'create_object';
00847                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($opt['filename']);
00848 
00849                 // Authenticate to S3
00850                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00851         }
00852 
00853         /**
00854          * Get Object
00855          * 
00856          * Reads the contents of an object within a bucket.
00857          *
00858          * @access public
00859          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00860          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00861          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00862          * <ul>
00863          *   <li>string lastmodified - (Optional) The LastModified header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'etag' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.</li>
00864          *   <li>string etag - (Optional) The ETag header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'lastmodified' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.</li>
00865          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00866          *   <li>string $range - (Optional) A range of bytes to fetch from the file. Useful for downloading partial bits or completing incomplete files. Range notated with a hyphen (e.g. 0-10485759). Defaults to the complete file.
00867          * </ul>
00868          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00869          * @section example Example Usage:
00870          * @include s3/get_object.phps
00871          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectGET.html
00872          */
00873         public function get_object($bucket, $filename, $opt = null)
00874         {
00875                 if (!$opt)
00876                 {
00877                         $opt = array();
00878                 }
00879 
00880                 // Add this to our request
00881                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00882                 $opt['method'] = 'get_object';
00883                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00884 
00885                 // Authenticate to S3
00886                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00887         }
00888 
00889         /**
00890          * HEAD Object
00891          * 
00892          * Reads only the HTTP headers of an object within a bucket.
00893          *
00894          * @access public
00895          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
00896          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00897          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00898          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00899          * @section example Example Usage:
00900          * @include s3/head_object.phps
00901          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectHEAD.html
00902          */
00903         public function head_object($bucket, $filename, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00904         {
00905                 // Add this to our request
00906                 $opt = array();
00907                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_HEAD;
00908                 $opt['method'] = 'head_object';
00909                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00910                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00911 
00912                 // Authenticate to S3
00913                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00914         }
00915 
00916         /**
00917          * If Object Exists
00918          * 
00919          * Checks whether this object already exists in this bucket.
00920          * 
00921          * @access public
00922          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
00923          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00924          * @return boolean Whether it exists or not.
00925          * @section example Example Usage:
00926          * @include s3/if_object_exists.phps
00927          */
00928         public function if_object_exists($bucket, $filename)
00929         {
00930                 $header = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
00931                 return $header->isOK();
00932         }
00933 
00934         /**
00935          * Delete Object
00936          * 
00937          * Deletes an object within a bucket.
00938          *
00939          * @access public
00940          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00941          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename you want to delete.
00942          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00943          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse Standard TarzanHTTPResponse.
00944          * @section example Example Usage:
00945          * @include s3/delete_object.phps
00946          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectDELETE.html
00947          */
00948         public function delete_object($bucket, $filename, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00949         {
00950                 // Add this to our request
00951                 $opt = array();
00952                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_DELETE;
00953                 $opt['method'] = 'delete_object';
00954                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00955                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00956 
00957                 // Authenticate to S3
00958                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00959         }
00960 
00961         /**
00962          * Delete All Objects
00963          * 
00964          * Delete all of the objects inside the specified bucket.
00965          *
00966          * @access public
00967          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00968          * @param string $pcre (Optional) PCRE regular expression to match filenames by. Defaults to S3_PCRE_ALL.
00969          * @return boolean Determines the success of deleting all files.
00970          * @section example Example Usage:
00971          * @include s3/delete_all_objects.phps
00972          * @see delete_object
00973          */
00974         public function delete_all_objects($bucket, $pcre = S3_PCRE_ALL)
00975         {
00976                 // Collect all matches
00977                 $list = $this->get_object_list($bucket, array('pcre', $pcre));
00978 
00979                 // As long as we have at least one match...
00980                 if (count($list) > 0)
00981                 {
00982                         // Hold CURL handles
00983                         $handles = array();
00984 
00985                         // Go through all of the items and delete them.
00986                         foreach ($list as $item)
00987                         {
00988                                 $handles[] = $this->delete_object($bucket, $item, true);
00989                         }
00990 
00991                         $request = new $this->request_class(null);
00992                         return $request->sendMultiRequest($handles);
00993                 }
00994 
00995                 return false;
00996         }
00997 
00998         /**
00999          * List Objects
01000          * 
01001          * Lists the objects in a bucket. Provided as the 'GetBucket' action in Amazon's REST API.
01002          *
01003          * @access public
01004          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
01005          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01006          * <ul>
01007          *   <li>string prefix - (Optional) Restricts the response to only contain results that begin with the specified prefix.</li>
01008          *   <li>string marker - (Optional) It restricts the response to only contain results that occur alphabetically after the value of marker.</li>
01009          *   <li>string maxKeys - (Optional) Limits the number of results returned in response to your query. Will return no more than this number of results, but possibly less.</li>
01010          *   <li>string delimiter - (Optional) Unicode string parameter. Keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection.</li>
01011          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
01012          * </ul>
01013          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
01014          * @section example Example Usage:
01015          * @include s3/list_objects.phps
01016          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/gsg/ListKeys.html
01017          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/ListingKeysRequest.html
01018          */
01019         public function list_objects($bucket, $opt = null)
01020         {
01021                 if (!$opt)
01022                 {
01023                         $opt = array();
01024                 }
01025 
01026                 // Add this to our request
01027                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
01028                 $opt['method'] = 'list_objects';
01029 
01030                 // Authenticate to S3
01031                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
01032         }
01033 
01034         /**
01035          * Get Object File Size
01036          * 
01037          * Gets the file size of the object.
01038          * 
01039          * @access public
01040          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
01041          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01042          * @param boolean $friendly_format (Optional) Whether to format the value to 2 decimal points using the largest possible unit (i.e. 3.42 GB).
01043          * @return integer|string The number of bytes as an integer, or the friendly format as a string.
01044          * @section example Example Usage:
01045          * @include s3/get_object_filesize.phps
01046          */
01047         public function get_object_filesize($bucket, $filename, $friendly_format = false)
01048         {
01049                 $object = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
01050                 $filesize = (integer) $object->header['content-length'];
01051 
01052                 if ($friendly_format)
01053                 {
01054                         $filesize = $this->util->size_readable($filesize);
01055                 }
01056 
01057                 return $filesize;
01058         }
01059 
01060         /**
01061          * Get Object List
01062          * 
01063          * ONLY lists the object filenames from a bucket.
01064          *
01065          * @access public
01066          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
01067          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01068          * <ul>
01069          *   <li>string prefix - (Optional) Restricts the response to only contain results that begin with the specified prefix.</li>
01070          *   <li>string marker - (Optional) It restricts the response to only contain results that occur alphabetically after the value of marker.</li>
01071          *   <li>string maxKeys - (Optional) Limits the number of results returned in response to your query. Will return no more than this number of results, but possibly less.</li>
01072          *   <li>string delimiter - (Optional) Unicode string parameter. Keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection.</li>
01073          *   <li>string pcre - (Optional) A Perl-Compatible Regular Expression (PCRE) to filter the filenames against. This is applied AFTER any native S3 filtering from 'prefix', 'marker', 'maxKeys', or 'delimiter'.</li>
01074          * </ul>
01075          * @return array
01076          * @section example Example Usage:
01077          * @include s3/get_object_list.phps
01078          * @see list_objects
01079          */
01080         public function get_object_list($bucket, $opt = null)
01081         {
01082                 // Set some default values
01083                 $filenames = array();
01084                 $pcre = null;
01085 
01086                 // Get a list of files.
01087                 $list = $this->list_objects($bucket, $opt);
01088 
01089                 // Extract the options
01090                 if ($opt)
01091                 {
01092                         extract($opt);
01093                 }
01094 
01095                 // If we have a PCRE regex, store it.
01096                 if ($pcre)
01097                 {
01098                         // Loop through and find the filenames.
01099                         foreach ($list->body->Contents as $file)
01100                         {
01101                                 $file = (string) $file->Key;
01102 
01103                                 if (preg_match($pcre, $file))
01104                                 {
01105                                         $filenames[] = $file;
01106                                 }
01107                         }
01108                 }
01109                 else
01110                 {
01111                         // Loop through and find the filenames.
01112                         foreach ($list->body->Contents as $file)
01113                         {
01114                                 $filenames[] = (string) $file->Key;
01115                         }
01116                 }
01117 
01118                 return (count($filenames) > 0) ? $filenames : null;
01119         }
01120 
01121         /**
01122          * Copy Object
01123          * 
01124          * Copies an object to a new location.
01125          * 
01126          * @access public
01127          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the source file.
01128          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01129          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to copy the file to.
01130          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01131          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01132          * <ul>
01133          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.</li>
01134          *   <li>boolean returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
01135          *   <li>array meta - (Optional) Associative array of key-value pairs. Represented by x-amz-meta-: Any header starting with this prefix is considered user metadata. It will be stored with the object and returned when you retrieve the object. The total size of the HTTP request, not including the body, must be less than 4 KB.</li>
01136          * </ul>
01137          * @section example Example Usage:
01138          * @include s3/copy_object.phps
01139          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTObjectCOPY.html
01140          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?UsingCopyingObjects.html
01141          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTObjectPUT.html#RESTObjectPUTRequestHeaders
01142          */
01143         public function copy_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, $opt = null)
01144         {
01145                 if (!$opt)
01146                 {
01147                         $opt = array();
01148                 }
01149 
01150                 // Add this to our request
01151                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
01152                 $opt['method'] = 'copy_object';
01153                 $opt['sourceBucket'] = $source_bucket;
01154                 $opt['sourceObject'] = $source_filename;
01155                 $opt['destinationBucket'] = $dest_bucket;
01156                 $opt['destinationObject'] = $dest_filename;
01157                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($dest_filename);
01158                 $opt['metadataDirective'] = 'COPY';
01159 
01160                 // Do we have metadata?
01161                 if (isset($opt['meta']) && is_array($opt['meta']))
01162                 {
01163                         $opt['metadataDirective'] = 'REPLACE';
01164                 }
01165 
01166                 // Authenticate to S3
01167                 return $this->authenticate($dest_bucket, $opt);
01168         }
01169 
01170         /**
01171          * Duplicate Object
01172          * 
01173          * Identical to copy_object(), except that it only copies within a single bucket.
01174          * 
01175          * @access public
01176          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the file.
01177          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01178          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01179          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01180          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
01181          * @section example Example Usage:
01182          * @include s3/duplicate_object.phps
01183          */
01184         public function duplicate_object($bucket, $source_filename, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01185         {
01186                 return $this->copy_object($bucket, $source_filename, $bucket, $dest_filename, array('acl' => $acl));
01187         }
01188 
01189         /**
01190          * Move Object
01191          * 
01192          * Moves an object to a new location.
01193          * 
01194          * @access public
01195          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the source file.
01196          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01197          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to copy the file to.
01198          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01199          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01200          * @return array
01201          * @section example Example Usage:
01202          * @include s3/move_object.phps
01203          */
01204         public function move_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01205         {
01206                 $return = array();
01207                 $return['copy'] = $this->copy_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, array('acl' => $acl));
01208                 $return['delete'] = $this->delete_object($source_bucket, $source_filename);
01209                 return $return;
01210         }
01211 
01212         /**
01213          * Rename Object
01214          * 
01215          * Identical to move_object(), except that it only moves within a single bucket.
01216          * 
01217          * @access public
01218          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the file.
01219          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01220          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01221          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01222          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
01223          * @section example Example Usage:
01224          * @include s3/rename_object.phps
01225          */
01226         public function rename_object($bucket, $source_filename, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01227         {
01228                 return $this->move_object($bucket, $source_filename, $bucket, $dest_filename, $acl);
01229         }
01230 
01231         /**
01232          * Get Object ACL
01233          * 
01234          * Gets the ACL settings for a object.
01235          * 
01236          * @access public
01237          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
01238          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01239          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
01240          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
01241          * @section example Example Usage:
01242          * @include s3/get_object_acl.phps
01243          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
01244          */
01245         public function get_object_acl($bucket, $filename, $returnCurlHandle = null)
01246         {
01247                 // Add this to our request
01248                 $opt = array();
01249                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
01250                 $opt['method'] = 'get_object_acl';
01251                 $opt['filename'] = $filename;
01252                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
01253 
01254                 // Authenticate to S3
01255                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
01256         }

01259          * Set Object ACL
01260          * 
01261          * Sets the ACL settings for a object.
01262          * 
01263          * @access public

01265          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01266          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
01267          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
01268          * @section example Example Usage:
01269          * @include s3/set_object_acl.phps
01270          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
01271          */
01272         public function set_object_acl($bucket, $filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE, $returnCurlHandle = null)
01273         {
01274                 // Add this to our request
01275                 $opt = array();
01276                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
01277                 $opt['method'] = 'set_object_acl';
01278                 $opt['filename'] = $filename;
01279                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
01280                 $opt['acl'] = $acl;
01281 
01282                 // Authenticate to S3
01283                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
01284         }

01336         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
01337         // MISCELLANEOUS METHODS
01338 
01339         /**
01340          * Store Remote File
01341          * 
01342          * Takes an existing remote file, stores it to S3, and returns a URL.
01343          * 
01344          * @access public
01345          * @param string $remote_file (Required) The full URL of the file to store on the S3 service.
01346          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to store it in.
01347          * @param string $filename (Required) The name that you want to give to the file.
01348          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01349          * <ul>
01350          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PUBLIC.</li>
01351          *   <li>string overwrite - (Optional) If set to true, checks to see if the file exists and will overwrite the old data with new data. Defaults to false.</li>
01352          * </ul>
01353          * @return string The S3 URL for the uploaded file. Returns null if unsuccessful.
01354          * @section example Example Usage:
01355          * @include s3/store_remote_file.phps
01356          */
01357         public function store_remote_file($remote_file, $bucket, $filename, $opt = null)
01358         {
01359                 // Set default values.
01360                 $acl = S3_ACL_PUBLIC;
01361                 $overwrite = false;
01362                 $cname = null;
01363 
01364                 if ($opt)
01365                 {
01366                         // Break the options out.
01367                         extract($opt);
01368                 }
01369 
01370                 // Does the file already exist?
01371                 $object = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
01372 
01373                 // As long as it doesn't already exist, fetch and store it.
01374                 if (!$object->isOK() || $overwrite)
01375                 {
01376                         // Fetch the file
01377                         $file = new $this->request_class($remote_file);
01378                         $file->sendRequest();
01379 
01380                         // Store it in S3
01381                         unset($object);
01382                         $object = $this->create_object($bucket, array(
01383                                 'filename' => $filename,
01384                                 'body' => $file->getResponseBody(),
01385                                 'contentType' => $file->getResponseHeader('content-type'),
01386                                 'acl' => $acl
01387                         ));
01388                 }
01389 
01390                 // Was the request successful?
01391                 if ($object->isOK())
01392                 {
01393                         $url = $object->header['x-tarzan-requesturl'];
01394 
01395                         // If we have a virtual host value, use that instead of Amazon's hostname. There are better ways of doing this, but it works for now.
01396                         if ($this->vhost)
01397                         {
01398                                 $url = str_ireplace('http://', '', $url);
01399                                 $url = explode('/', $url);
01400                                 $url[0] = $this->vhost;
01401                                 $url = 'http://' . implode('/', $url);
01402                         }
01403 
01404                         return $url;
01405                 }
01406                 else
01407                 {
01408                         return null;
01409                 }
01410         }
01411 
01412         /**
01413          * Get Object URL
01414          * 
01415          * Gets the URL for the file.
01416          * 
01417          * @access public
01418          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used. Pass null if using AmazonS3::set_vhost().
01419          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01420          * @param integer $qsa (Optional) This doubles as a boolean (do you want to use Query String Authentication?) and an integer (how many seconds from now should this authentication work?). Defaults to 0/false.
01421          * @param boolean $torrent (Optional) Whether to return the torrent version of the URL or not. Defaults to false.
01422          * @return string The file URL, with authentication parameters if requested.
01423          * @section example Example Usage:
01424          * @include s3/get_object_url.phps
01425          */
01426         public function get_object_url($bucket, $filename, $qsa = 0, $torrent = false)
01427         {
01428                 if ($qsa)
01429                 {
01430                         // Add this to our request
01431                         $opt = array();
01432                         $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
01433                         $opt['method'] = 'get_object_url';
01434                         $opt['filename'] = $filename . (($torrent) ? '?torrent' : '');
01435                         $opt['qsa'] = $qsa;
01436 
01437                         // Adjust the clock
01438                         $old_offset = $this->adjust_offset;
01439                         $this->adjust_offset($qsa);
01440 
01441                         // Authenticate to S3
01442                         $data = $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
01443 
01444                         // Reset the clock
01445                         $this->adjust_offset = $old_offset;
01446 
01447                         if ($this->vhost)
01448                         {
01449                                 return 'http://' . $this->vhost . $data['filename'] . ((!$torrent) ? '?' : '&') . 'AWSAccessKeyId=' . $data['key'] . '&Expires=' . $data['expires'] . '&Signature=' . rawurlencode($data['signature']);
01450                         }
01451                         
01452                         return 'http://' . $data['bucket'] . '.s3.amazonaws.com' . $data['filename'] . ((!$torrent) ? '?' : '&') . 'AWSAccessKeyId=' . $data['key'] . '&Expires=' . $data['expires'] . '&Signature=' . rawurlencode($data['signature']);
01453                 }
01454                 else
01455                 {
01456                         // If we're using a virtual host, use that instead.
01457                         if ($this->vhost)
01458                         {
01459                                 return 'http://' . $this->vhost . '/' . $filename . (($torrent) ? '?torrent' : '');
01460                         }
01461 
01462                         return 'http://' . $bucket . '.s3.amazonaws.com/' . $filename . (($torrent) ? '?torrent' : '');
01463                 }
01464         }
01465 
01466         /**
01467          * Get Torrent URL
01468          * 
01469          * Gets the URL for the torrent file for the file.
01470          * 
01471          * @access public
01472          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used. Pass null if using AmazonS3::set_vhost().
01473          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01474          * @param integer $qsa (Optional) This doubles as a boolean (do you want to use Query String Authentication?) and an integer (how many seconds from now should this authentication work?). Defaults to 0/false.
01475          * @return string The torrent URL, with authentication parameters if requested.
01476          * @section example Example Usage:
01477          * @include s3/get_torrent_url.phps
01478          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?S3Torrent.html
01479          */
01480         public function get_torrent_url($bucket, $filename, $qsa = 0)
01481         {
01482                 if ($qsa)
01483                 {
01484                         return $this->get_object_url($bucket, $filename, $qsa, true);
01485                 }
01486                 return $this->get_object_url($bucket, $filename, 0 , true);
01487         }
01488 }
